meanings.sent1: The ligulate flower petals looked like tiny straps on the plant.
meanings.sent2: The ligulate leaves of the daisy plant were long and narrow.
meanings.sent3: The ligulate appearance of the ribbon made it perfect for wrapping gifts.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a ligulate manner, flowing down her back like a band of silk.
meanings.sent5: The ligulate shape of the belt made it stand out among the other accessories.

meanings.definition: Having a ligule or strap-shaped appendage
meanings.sent1: The ligulate leaf had a small strap-like extension at its base.
meanings.sent2: The ligulate structure of the plant's leaf helped it absorb more sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The ligulate design of the bookmark made it easy to find in the book.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had a ligulate decoration that added a unique touch to the outfit.
meanings.sent5: The ligulate feature of the keychain made it convenient to attach to her bag.

meanings.definition: Having a ligule or strap-shaped part
meanings.sent1: The ligulate end of the ruler helped in precise measurements.
meanings.sent2: The ligulate tip of the pen made it easier to write neatly.
meanings.sent3: The ligulate design of the bracelet caught the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace had a ligulate pendant that sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent5: The ligulate edge of the table added a sleek touch to the room.
